Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the speed at which the website will be developed and the coverage it will have across the country.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Google is directly developing the website, when in fact it is being developed by Google's sister company, Verily.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up the statements made about the website's development and coverage.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the website is initially limited to the San Francisco Bay Area, rather than being available to all Americans.
Understate: The claim understates the limitations and scope of the website by not mentioning its initial limited availability and its specific purpose for screening in the San Francisco Bay Area.
Falters at times: The claim falters in accurately representing the involvement of Google in the development of the website and the extent of its availability.
